sen.j: 伏見宮栄仁親王（ふしみのみや よしひとしんのう・榮仁親王、
sen.e: Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito
Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Yoshihito

sen.j: 観応2年/正平 6年（1351年） - 応永23年11月20日 （1416年12月9日））は、南北朝時代、室町時代の日本の皇族。
sen.e: (1351 - December 9, 1416) was Japanese Imperial family member during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties and the Muromachi period.
(1351 - December 9, 1416) was Japanese Imperial family member during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties and the Muromachi period.
(1351 - December 9, 1416) was Japanese Imperial family member during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts and the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: Dynasties -> Courts に変更しました。

sen.j: 読み方は「なかひと」とも。
sen.e: His name was also pronounced 'Nakahito'.
His name was also pronounced 'Nakahito.'
His name was also pronounced 'Nakahito.'

sen.j: 世襲親王家、伏見宮初代当主。
sen.e: The hereditary Imperial family, the first head of the Fushiminomiya family.
The hereditary Imperial family, the first head of the Fushiminomiya family.
The hereditary Imperial family, the first head of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見殿、有栖川殿などと称する。
sen.e: He was called Fushimi dono or Arisugawa dono.
He was called Fushimi dono or Arisugawa dono.
He was called Fushimi dono or Arisugawa dono.

sen.j: 系譜
sen.e: Geneaology
Geneaology
Genealogy

sen.j: 北朝 第3代崇光天皇の第1皇子。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of the third Northern Dynasty Emperor, Emperor Suko.
He was the first Prince of the third Northern Dynasty Emperor, Emperor Suko.
He was the first Prince of the third Northern Dynasty Emperor, Emperor Suko.

sen.j: 母は、大納言庭田重資の女、典侍源資子。
sen.e: His mother was Dainagon, Shigesuke NIWATA's daughter, Naishinosuke (Naishinosuke (Tenji) (a court lady of the first rank), MINAMOTO no Shishi. (Sukeko)
His mother was Dainagon, Shigesuke NIWATA's daughter, Naishinosuke (Naishinosuke (Tenji) (a court lady of the first rank), MINAMOTO no Shishi. (Sukeko)
His mother was Dainagon, Shigesuke NIWATA's daughter, Naishinosuke (Naishinosuke (Tenji) (a court lady of the first rank), MINAMOTO no Shishi (Sukeko).

sen.j: 御息所は三条家実治（清華家）の女、藤原治子（西御方）。
sen.e: His Miyasundokoro (a consort of the imperial Prince) was Saneharu SANJO's (the Seiga family) daughter, FUJIWARA no Haruko (Nishi no Onkata).
His Miyasundokoro (a consort of the imperial Prince) was Saneharu SANJO's (the Seiga family) daughter, FUJIWARA no Haruko (Nishi no Onkata).
His Miyasundokoro (a consort of the imperial Prince) was Saneharu SANJO's (the Seiga family) daughter, FUJIWARA no Haruko (Nishi no Onkata).

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 応安元年/正平23年（1368年）正月親王宣下を受け、栄仁と命名される。
sen.e: He received to title to become Imperial Prince in the New Year of 1368, and was named Yoshihito.
He received title of Imperial Prince in the New Year of 1368, and was named Yoshihito.
He received title of Imperial Prince in the New Year of 1368, and was named Yoshihito.

sen.j: 永和 元年/天授 元年（1375年）11月元服し、二品に叙せられる。
sen.e: He had a coming-of-age ceremony in November 1375 and received Nihon. (the second of Imperial Prince's rank)
He had a coming-of-age ceremony in November 1375 and received Nihon (the second rank for a Prince).
He had a coming-of-age ceremony in November 1375 and received Nihon (the second rank for a Prince).

sen.j: 父帝崇光太上天皇は、持明院統嫡流として第一皇子である栄仁親王の即位を念願していた。
sen.e: His father, the Grand Emperor Suko wished Imperial Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne, who was the first Prince within the successors of the Jimyo-in Imperial line.
His father, the Grand Emperor Suko wished Imperial Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne, who was the first Prince within the successors of the Jimyo-in Imperial line.
His father, the Grand Emperor Suko wished Imperial Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne, who was the first Prince within the successors of the Jimyoin Imperial line.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。

sen.j: しかし、皇統が南北朝時代_、さらには北朝自体が崇光上皇、栄仁親王の系統と崇光天皇の弟である後光厳天皇の系統に分立するなど、
sen.e: However the Imperial line was separated into a few different ones such as the retired Emperor Suko's line of the Northern Dynasty and Emperor Gokogon's line who was Emperor Suko's younger brother during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties,

However the Imperial line was separated into a few different ones such as the retired Emperor Suko's line of the Northern Dynasty and Emperor Gokogon's line who was Emperor Suko's younger brother during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties,

However the Imperial line was separated into a few different ones such as the retired Emperor Suko's line of the Northern Court and Emperor Gokogon's line who was Emperor Suko's younger brother during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: ,をピリオドに訂正しました。Dynasty -> Court に変更しました。

sen.j: 情勢は栄仁親王の登極が実現するには厳しいものがあった。
sen.e: It was not the best situation for Imperial Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne.
It was not the best situation for Imperial Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne.
It was not the best situation for Imperial Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne.

sen.j: 応永5年（1398年）正月崇光上皇が崩御され、最大の後ろ盾を失った栄仁親王は、同年5月出家した。
sen.e: After the retired Emperor Suko died in the New Year of 1398 Imperial Prince Yoshihito lost his powerful political supporter and went into priesthood in May 1398.
After the retired Emperor Suko died in the New Year of 1398, Imperial Prince Yoshihito lost his powerful political supporter and went into the priesthood in May 1398.
After the retired Emperor Suko died in the New Year of 1398, Imperial Prince Yoshihito lost his powerful political supporter and went into the priesthood in May 1398.

sen.j: 法名は通智（つうち）。
sen.e: His Buddhist name was Tsuchi.
His Buddhist name was Tsuchi.
His Buddhist name was Tsuchi.

sen.j: 同年8月に洛北萩原殿に移る。
sen.e: He moved to Hagiwara dono on the northern part of Kyoto in August 1398.
He moved to Hagiwara dono on the northern part of Kyoto in August 1398.
He moved to Hagiwara-dono Palace on the northern part of Kyoto in August 1398.
sen.cmt: スペースをハイフンにしました。Palace補足しました。

sen.j: 応永6年（1399年）12月伏見殿に移るが、応永8年（1401年）伏見殿が火事で焼け落ち、嵯峨 (京都市)洪恩院に移る。
sen.e: He then moved to Fushimi dono in December 1399, however the Fushimi dono was burnt down with the fire (1401) and the Prince moved to Koonin in Saga. (Kyoto City)
sen.cmt: 洪恩院→Koonin [読み方確認できず]
sen.e: He then moved to Fushimi dono in December 1399, however it was burnt down (1401) and the Prince moved to Koonin in Saga (Kyoto City).
He then moved to Fushimi-dono Palace in December 1399, however it was burnt down (1401) and the Prince moved to Koonin in Saga (Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: スペースをハイフンにしました。Palace補足しました。

sen.j: 応永10年（1403年）には有栖川山荘（有栖川殿）に移り、有栖川殿と称する。
sen.e: In 1403 the Prince moved to Arisugawa mountain villa (Arisugawa dono) and named Arisugawadono.
In 1403 the Prince moved to Arisugawa mountain villa (Arisugawa dono) and named it Arisugawadono.
In 1403 the Prince moved to Arisugawa mountain villa (Arisugawa-dono Palace) and named it Arisugawa dono.
sen.cmt: スペースをハイフンにしました。Palace補足しました。スペース補足。

sen.j: 遍歴を余儀なくされた親王であるが、応永16年（1409年）6月に皇室累代の禁裏御料である伏見に戻り、伏見殿と称されるようになる。
sen.e: Although the Prince had to wondered around different places, he moved back to Fushimi, where the Imperial estate of the Imperial successive generations and was called Fushimidono.
Although the Prince had to wander around different places, he moved back to Fushimi, where the Imperial estate of successive Imperial generations was called Fushimidono.
Although the Prince had to wander around different places, in June 1409 he moved back to Fushimi, where the Imperial estate of successive Imperial generations was called Fushimi dono.
sen.cmt: スペース補足。年号補足

sen.j: 親王の伏見御料は、以後子孫相次いで伝領され、これが伏見宮の起源となる。
sen.e: The Prince's Imperial estate was successively passed to his descendants by generations to generations after that, it became the origin of Fushiminomiya.
The Prince's Imperial estate was successively passed to his descendants from generation to generation after that, it became the origin of Fushiminomiya.
The Prince's Imperial estate was successively passed to his descendants from generation to generation after that, it became the origin of Fushiminomiya.
He died on November 20, 1416.
He died on November 20, 1416.
He died on December 18, 1416.
He was sixty six years old.
He was sixty six years old.
He was sixty six years old.

sen.j: 法号は大通院。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Daitsuin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Daitsuin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Daitsuin.

sen.j: また、栄仁親王は、琵琶、笙、和歌など諸芸能に堪能で、伏見宮家が楽道を家業とする起源を作った。
sen.e: He had many talents in arts such as Biwa (a (four-stringed Japanese) lute), a sho (a wind instrument composed of a mouthpiece and seventeen bamboo pipes of various lengths), waka poems and established the origin for the Fushiminomiyha family to start music as their family business.

He had many talents in art such as Biwa (a four-stringed Japanese lute), a sho (a wind instrument composed of a mouthpiece and seventeen bamboo pipes of various lengths), waka poems, and established the origin for the Fushiminomiyha family to start music as their family business.

He had many talents in art such as Biwa (a four-stringed Japanese lute), a sho (a wind instrument composed of a mouthpiece and seventeen bamboo pipes of various lengths), waka poems, and established the origin for the Fushiminomiyha family to start music as their family business.
